intro: Setiscapella subulata, commonly known as the slender setiscapella, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific alpine regions. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves that are adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in full sun exposure. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white in color, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
